page.title: 03MICHELMERSH POST OFFICE
page.content: The present{Michelmersh Post {Office}has been open since l984. It is situated in the Brickworks itself. It was opened so that the old people in Michelmersh didn't have to go in to Romsey to post their letters. It is also a general store and sells things such as tea, coffee, sweets and cereals. The workmen from the Brickworks buy their lunch at the general store so that they don't have to bring a packed lunch. There are four employees at the { {Post Office.}It is only small and doesn't receive many letters because there is a post box down the road. They receive about three parcels and fifty letters a day but they do not sort them as Southampton branch deals with this. The Brickworks' office is next to the{Post Office}and from there you can see most of the Brickworks.
